inn1.comm: fuller and quicker on the off stump and what do we have here! he has lofted it over where mid-off would be, and fortunately it falls short of long-off, aggression first up!
shorter, quicker, no turn and Gayle defends, a tad nervously if I may add
fuller and edged, just came off the shoulder of the bat and falls short of the backward point! already the bounce on show
fuller and this time he drives it wide of long-off, comes back for the second, was in the air
fuller on the off and he goes for the sweep, does not time it too well and goes to short fine-leg
fullish delivery on the off stump, hint of spin away and Gayle plonks his foot forward and defends
fullish and swinging back into the bat, a lot of swing in fact and it drifts down the leg side, flicked away to in front of square-leg
short of length and it is on his pads, easily tucked away to fine-leg for a four, the fine-leg fielder was inside the circle
outside the off this time, gets his line right and gets a shouldering of arms from the batsman, through to the keeper
and back to bowling down the leg side, very neatly tucked and there is a good chance given by Anamul Haque, dives at deep mid-wicket but cannot get it back, another four
short of length on the off stump and he goes back, pushes it back to the bowler, who fields and throws it back
again marginally outside the off, punched to the point fielder
floated up on the off stump and Gayle wants to go over, but struggles to get his timing, inside edge to the leg side
drifts down the leg side, wants to sweep but misses
fuller on the middle, driven to short cover
another one down the pads, gets bit of something I thought but given wides, the keeper fumbles as well and they are through for a single

whoa, gone, stumped! beaten by the turn, he was going the track but misses the turn, beaten and is almost half-way down the pitch, Rahim waits for a second and then whips off the bails...and uproots the stumps with an aggressively completed stumping!
quicker on the off stump and there seemed like some turn and bounce, did it come off the gloves, pops up but away from the keeper on the leg side
on the middle and defended back to the bowler
driven down the ground to long-on to get off the mark does the centurion from the third ODI
short of length and stump to stump, defended on the back foot, defended back to the bowler
fuller and on the off and Samuels, as his habit against deliveries even at that length, goes back and pushes it to the covers
on the off stump, a good length delivery and defended to the covers
outside the off stump, and another ball on the right length, lets it go through to the keeper
outside the off and swing away from the batsman, he is on the front foot this time but only pushes it to the covers
keeps bowling that channel, outside the off stump, and decent length, defended to the off side, ends an excellent over
on the middle and defended to the off side
on the middle and angling in to the batsman, hits the pads and there is an appeal but that was going way down the leg side
this is on the middle stump yet again and he tries to sweep it this time, gets some bat but not enough to get it away
on the off stump and defended to the off side
fuller on the middle and pushed to mid-on but again, no run!
the off stump line this time and Gayle pushes his bat and pad forward and defends
on the off stump, coming in with a bit of angle, defended back to the bowler

run-out appeal here! Samuels is gone there, run-out, direct hit from Mahmudullah! so when he is not scoring runs or picking wickets, he running 'em out! it was tapped to the leg side and they went for a quick single, Mahmudullah came in quickly and threw at the non-striker's stumps, just a few inches out
outside the off and he lets it go through to the keeper, no run scored for 15 balls
outside the off and that swings prodigiously away from Gayle's bat, misses the outside edge, close!
outside the off and absolutely crunched through...but well fielded in the covers by Mahmudullah again!
short of length and punched to the off side to complete the third maiden in a row, a wicket too
short of length, turning away, tries to cut it away, straight to the point fielder
on the middle, nudged to the short fine-leg fielder
outside the off and spinning away, misses the outside edge, through to the keeper
whoa, lot of turn away from the bat, he was playing forward and misses the outside edge again
outside the off and there is a lot of turn there again, not getting any bat on it!
short of length and comes in with the arm and would you believe it, it's the fourth maiden in a row
slower one and beaten, he was going for a slam before trying to check it, beats the outside edge and goes on the bounce to the keeper

gone, Gayle's gone, is it, yes he is! he cut it hard and it went flying to the backward point fielder, straight into the hands and he is waiting to see whether it went straight into the hands. Umpire's gives him the marching orders now and West Indies have slumped to 3/17
on the middle stump and defended back to the bowler
on the off stump and brings his bat and pad out together and defends to the off side
bouncer and he sways away from the line of ball and lets it go
good length ball on the off stump and defends on the front foot, that is the fifth successive maiden over
short of length, no turn there and goes straight on, tries to cut but gets it to covers
shorter in length and defended off the back foot, pushed through the two slips in place to the backward point
outside the off and turning further away from the bat, Bravo lets it go
and finally a run, shorter this time and Bravo cuts it hard and through the backward point region for a four
on the middle and fuller, defended to the leg side, called for a quick one and gets there before the throw comes in
defended to the leg side, Pollard's going to be playing a different game here
outside the off, short of length and lets it go through to the keeper
whoa, swing away or was it some grip from the pitch, he was on the back foot and the bat sneaks through the outside of his bat
fuller, outside the off stump and lets it go through to the keeper
punched and through the covers, lot of class there, short of length and he stands up tall and smacks it away in the gap
back to bowling slightly fuller and on the middle, angling away, pushed to the off side
comes on nicely on to the bat there and he punches it to the off side and straight to the covers
outside the off and no turn, it was fuller and he goes back, it keeps low and seeps through!
wow, against the run of play, it was overpitched and he goes over the mid-wicket region, the power of the man takes it over the fence for a six
on the back foot and defends it to the leg side
and he is shouldering arms to one that pitches on middle! wow! luckily it spins down the leg side and the appeal is aborted
wants to defend on the front foot and misses the outside edge, through to the keeper, what an over
shorter this time and Pollard is happier defending this one to mid-wicket
outside the off and he allows it go through to the keeper, got his lines right after the poor first over
short of length and he was on the back foot and defending it back to the bowler
fuller and slower and Bravo had a huge back-lift, before needing to adjust his stroke
short of length and pushed to the covers, the ball was on the middle stump and he is getting no room to free his arms
outside the off and swinging away, or probably it is the angle, goes for a drive and misses the outside edge through to the keeper
outside the off and he wants to cut hard, misses the outside edge and that completes another maiden, his fourth this game
on the off stump and defended to the off side
on his pads and that is driven down the ground for a single
short of length, on the back foot and defended to the off side
outside the off and he pats it to the off side yet again
drifts on to the middle this time and he flicks it to the short mid-wicket fielder
short of length outside the off and he rocks back, cuts hard and through to the sweeper for a single
on the off stump and floated up to the bat, misses the outside edge trying to defend it
on the off stump, and he pats it to the off side
short of length and he cuts hard, goes to the sweeper fielder for a single
round the stumps, on the middle and looks to angle in before spinning away, tucked to the leg side but not for a run
slips through quicker this time and it goes through and hits the pads
fuller on the middle and driven to long-on for a single
short and wide and he wanted to cut it, but did not come on to the bat, hit back
flat, flat six, it was fuller and he did not even have his weight forward, still able to smack him over the bowler's head
short arm jab and that has been deposited over the long-on fence for another six, counter-attack
on the off stump and pulls his length back as well and he defends it to the off side
on the middle stump and he defends with his bat and pad forward
blocks it away to the leg side and there is a call of "No, no, no!" from him
shorter from the left-hander, goes back and pushes it down the ground for a single
short of length and angling in, goes back and wants to hit it through the mid-wicket but does not get it through

down the ground for his fourth six! what power, he is just timing them, not wanting to go savagely at them and yet is able to push it over the fielder at long-on, it was not really full but the batsman gets full value
quicker, flatter, on the middle and defended to the off side
shorter, wider and he rocks back and hits it hard, the cut goes through to the sweeper
slower, on the middle from over the wicket and defended to the leg side
flatter and lot of turn back into the batsman, he was defending forward and got nowhere near the bat
shortens his length, and he is back, defending on-side
good length outside the off and no turn this time, he was pushing forward and again goes through the outside edge
short of length, he was going forward before quickly rocking back and hitting it in the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket
short of length this time and cuts it through the short third-man region for a couple, no turn on that one
outside the off and he wanted to go after it, attempts to hit it over long-off, but he was playing for the turn and it goes straight on, misses the outside edge, to the keeper
on the middle stump and he defends it to the leg side
shortens the length and he is quickly on the back foot, defends to the left of the bowler
fuller and driven to the short mid-wicket fielder, fielded well
short of length and spinning into the batsman, wants to cut it but does not get it in the gap
fuller and driven down the ground for a single
short of length and he is quickly back, punches it down the ground, should have been fielded by Razzaq on his right but it goes through for a single
fuller on the off stump and Pollard drives it down the ground for a single
round the stumps, flatter and no turn, hits the pads and there is an appeal for an lbw but was going down the leg side
short of length and on the middle, turn takes it on to his pads, tries to flick it but to the short fine-leg fielder
quicker, flatter and that is because it is to Pollard, defended to the leg side
flatter yet again and he gets his front foot out, defends and it flies off the inside-edge, there is no-one close it though
no air given and he flicks it to the square-leg fielder, not for runs though, better over there
fuller on the middle and driven to the leg side but to the short mid-wicket fielder
on the middle, quicker and defended on the front foot
it is on his pads, wants to sweep it, the turn undoes his sweep
on the off stump and he pushes it to the short cover fielder
middle stump line but again a lot of turn, gets it away to short fine-leg
off stump line and Bravo neatly plays it point to end a maiden from Razzaq
that is a lot of turn but like yesterday, Mahmudullah misses his line again, it was on the middle stump and spun very viciously down the leg side, batsman lets it go, so does the keeper!
middle and fuller this time and Pollard defends it back to the bowler
room given and smoked away over mid-wicket and this is what Pollard was speaking of, yep that's halfway to Khulna!
shorter and some bounce outside the off, no turn there and beats the outside the edge
shorter yet again and he goes back and cuts it through the point region, for a single only
fuller to Bravo, and he is on the front foot, wanting to tap it to the off side, gets it to the fielder
shorter and slow turn, wants to cut it away but has to check the stroke for the slowness of the ball and then plays it through backward point, bit of misfield and they get a couple
round the stumps, on the off stump and defended to the off side
turn and bounce and he is on the back foot, playing it to the short cover fielder
drifts on to his pads, whipped away to the deep square-leg for a single
on the pads and it is tickled round the corner to short fine-leg but it looks like it has missed his pads and it is called a wide
on the off stump and Bravo pushes it into the covers and is off for a quick one, good calling and running
shorter and he whips it away to the mid-wicket fielder, straight to him and not for a run
wow what a shot, that was short enough to pull but the ball pitches middle and spins sharply away from the bat and he is able to put it over mid-wicket for another four
lot of turn from over the wicket, wants to flick it away, hits the pads
too short and wants to pull it away, does a good job of it but it goes in the air and carries to the deep square-leg fielder and Nassir Hossain drops it!
fuller on the off stump and defended to the off side
fuller and on the middle stump, he goes forward and smacks it over the bowler's head, smothering any turn and deposits it near the sight-screen, half-century for the big man!
shorter this time, as expected, and he is quickly on the back-foot, waits for the turn and cracks it over mid-wicket for a flat six!
shorter and he is on the back foot, but this has more bounce and he defends it
fuller on the off stump and he drives it to the mid-off fielder
short of length and that has spanked away through the covers for a four, good shot by Bravo, after watching his partner dispatch all those shots away
short of length, outside the off and he wants to cut it away, gets the inside edge and goes to the fine-leg fielder
fuller on the off stump and driven to mid-off, call of a "No!" as Pollard was preparing to go for a run
shorter and wider, bit of a slower bouncer and he is tempted to go after it, but lets it go in the end
short of length and he is quickly on to his back foot, opens the face of the bat, guides it to third-man
outside the leg stump and hoping it will turn back, played to deep square-leg for a single
short of length, pushed down the ground to long-on for a single
fuller on the middle and he gets his front foot out and defends it to the off side
on the off stump and he pinches on to the off side, not for runs though
short of length and he wants to cut it, but it does not turn, cramped for space
opens the face of the bat through to short third-man, gets a single
bowls a tad shorter, turn back into the batsman, pushes it to long-on for a single
very short, and outside the off stump, turning away from the batsman and this time he takes it through the off side, easily hit in the gap and goes to wide long-off for a four
fuller on the middle stump and drilled down to long-on for a single
on the off stump, bit of turn into the left-hander, tapped away to the leg side to bring up the 100-run stand
round the stumps and angling into the batsman, quicker, flatter and does not get the sweep shot that he attempted
driven down the ground for another single to keep strike
slower in the air, turning back into the bowler and he lets it hit the pads
outside the off and there was no turn there, goes through with the arm and beats the outside edge of the bat
quicker and down the leg side, Pollard wants to flick it but misses, missed by the keeper too
another one that is sent down the leg-side, he tries it work it away, gets a bit of bat through to fine-leg for a couple
down the leg-side, trying to cramp him but wide called
on the middle stump, fuller and pushed to the off side
this is from round the stumps and fuller on the off stump, tapped and quickly off for a single
short of length from Gazi, immediately on the back foot and tucked away to mid-wicket who runs back to try and field it, misses and by the time the deep fielder comes in, they are back for the second
short of length and tapped away to short mid-wicket
lot of turn and down the leg side, spinning from the middle stump, not called a wide!
on the off stump from over the wicket, he gets his bat and pad together and plays it to the leg side
on the off and tapped away to short fine-leg for a single
round the stumps and over-pitched, gets bit of an outside edge to the off side
smacked but straight to the non-striker, who is hit by that one! it was shorter from the bowler and Pollard rocks back to pull it but hits Bravo
short of length, and cut away to the deep point fielder, a lot of turn but does not get the length right
very short and pulled away to the deep square-leg region for a four! there was turn back into the batsman but that did not matter too much to him
short again but this one does not turn, and the inside-edge goes to short mid-wicket
fuller from round the stumps and defended on the front foot
outside the off, flatter and angles away, misses the outside edge
on his pads and quicker, flatter, tucks it away to fine-leg, not for runs though
outside the off and fuller from the left-armer, pushed to the off side and easily rotates the strike
fuller on the leg stump and that is driven in the air to long-on, cries of "catch it" but that bounced before it got there.
wants to cut it, it was shorter and wider and he went for it, misses the outside edge
tucks it round the corner this time to deep square-leg for a single
round the stumps, bit of an angle into the batsman and that has been tonked over the bowler's head for his eighth six this innings, gone all the way!
and this is over the wicket, fuller and darted in and Pollard is still able to pick it up from there and send it in the gap between long-on and deep square-leg, some really effortless hitting here
fuller and on the off, tapped to the off side for a single
round the stumps and very short from Mahmudullah and quicker too, he wants to go for the pull, misses
round the stumps and round arm action as well, pitches outside the leg stump and hits the pads, appeal for an lbw
on the off stump and bit of spin back into him, plays it with the turn to long-on for a single
round the stumps and on the middle, angling down, he gets a bit of a bat and tucks it to short fine-leg
turn and he is on the back foot and defending
round the stumps, on the off and pushed to the off side for a quick one
slightly outside the off, and Bravo defends on the front foot
shorter this time on the off stump, defended on the back foot to short mid-wicket
poor ball, down the leg side and he can free his arms, slow sweeps it to the deep square-leg region for a single

gone, bowled him! just as I said that he has been hitting them all clean, he mis-hits one! it was on the off stump, not too much turn, holds his line and Pollard was going for it, missed it completely and the off stump is pegged back!
fuller and on the off stump driven down the ground for a single
and suddenly there is a lot of turn yet again, on the off stump and rips towards the leg side
outside the off stump and Sammy gets his pad out to try and pad it away, misses it
on the off stump, fullish this time and pushed to the off side
outside the off, enough for him to get his bat out and drives it through short cover for a single
round the stumps, and spinning away a little, wants to defend at it but gets a bit of an outside edge
fuller outside the off and Bravo brings out that flair-filled cover drive, but not in the gap

and one brings them two! the man-of-the-match from the previous game pushes at a ball away from the body, gets an outside edge and there is a fielder in the slips just for that shot, this time there are no dropped catches and Bangladesh are right in it!
round the stumps and instead of angling in, it goes past the outside edge
fuller on the off and this one, he drives through the covers for a single
Pollard's gone but Bravo's still there, it is floated up outside the off and he has spanked it over the bowler's head for a six!
on the middle stump, tapped away to short mid-wicket
lot of turn from round the stumps and pitching on the middle, it goes down the leg side for a couple of wides
shorter this time, not too much turn, punched down the ground for a single
on the middle stump and defended back to the bowler
shorter in length and bit of turn away from the bat, pushes it to the off side, the non-striker wanted a single
tucks it away to the leg side, not for runs though
fuller from the bowler, flighted up too and Bravo just taps it to the off and they are off for a quick one
shorter and outside off and Thomas pushes it to the off side
not pitching them in Thomas' half and he is able to push it back, to the right of the bowler, who fields and with that, the umpire calls for drinks
outside the off and very short, easily played in the gap through covers for a couple
goes through quicker and straighter, wanted to cut, misses
this time he cuts it, but does not get it in the gap, goes to backward point
on his pads and bit of turn back into the batsman, hits his pads
middle stump line and pushed to the leg side, not for runs
this time it is full enough for him to sweep it, gets it to fine-leg for a single
fuller on the middle, wants to play it through point but can only get it away to the fielder
tucked away to the leg side and for a single
short of length and that is tucked away to the mid-wicket fielder
shorter, flatter and down the leg side, and despite his attempt to sweep it, he is way away from it
gets room outside the off and that is cut away to the sweeper fielder
wants to cut it again but does not get it off the middle
slower, shorter and rocks back on to the back foot, pushes it through the covers this time
on the middle stump, slight turn into the batsman, taps it to the leg side
stylishly pushed away to the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on and they are able to come back for the second
outside edge missed, no turn for the bowler, goes through flatter and misses
wants to sweep it, but again, does not get anything on it, hits the pads there
quicker on the middle stump, works it away to the deep fielder on the leg side and gets an easy couple of runs to bring up a very, well-made fifty
vicious turn and down the leg side, lets that one go and wide called
despite batting for so long, there is always that delivery that troubles the batsman and it turns right back into him, almost hits him
fuller on the middle stump, no chance of turn from that length and he flicks it to mid-wicekt
outside the off, no turn this time and he was playing for the turn, misses the outside edge
fuller on the off stump and driven to the covers, bit of a misfield gets him a single
ooh! he was coming down the track and the bowler drops it short, it was turning as well and Bravo gets some bat on it, else he could well have been stranded!
quicker, comes in with the arm and he has to quickly defend it, gets an inside edge on to the pads
on the off stump and pushed to the covers
outside the off, turning away from the batsman, and it is slow turn, gets it through the covers for a single
he goes down the track yet again and for the second time he is beaten, it was turning in and hits the pads, rolls away to the short third-man region
quicker, going down the leg side, and hits the pads, big appeal for lbw, but wasn't hitting the stumps
it was fuller and he drills it over the mid-on fielder, just eludes the fielder there, goes over for a four!
whoa, what a ball! it was turning and bouncing, the batsman was squared up and the outside edge flew to the right of the first slip, almost a wicket
quicker and straighter and he is pinned on his back foot, beats the inside edge and there is that inevitable appeal but not-out given

gone, caught at short cover! Bravo was looking like he wanted to get a few runs and quickly and this just did not come on to the bat, gets a leading edge and it flies off the bat to short cover for a simple catch, a very well-compiled innings from him
round the stumps, outside the off and straighter with the arm, hits the pads and flies off to the off side
defended on the front foot, to the off side yet again
shorter, quicker and he is content defending it to the off side

gone, lbw off a full-toss! he was playing across the line from round the stumps, hits it on the full and the umpire immediately nodded his head before raising his finger, that looked out enough!, two wickets in the over and Bangladesh are right back into this one
round the stumps, and defended back to the bowler to end another maiden
round the stumps and on the middle, defended back to the bowler
quicker and flatter, keeps a tad low, and defended by the batsman
played away to the leg side for a single
on the off stump, not too much as the batsman brings his pads out and defends
quicker on the off stump and defended very quickly by the batsman
slower from the bowler, and turns away from the middle stump, almost has him playing across the line, the edge calls into the off side
slower, and getting some turn back into the batsman, tucks it to deep fine-leg for a single
fuller from round the stumps and it is driven back to the bowler
round arm from him, on the off stump and pushed to mid-wicket
quicker and on the middle stump and is happy tapping it to mid-wicket
round arm action yet again and it is on the leg stump, hits the pads and lobs up to the on side
pushes it to the off stump and tapped to the off side for a quick single
round the stumps and wants to sweep it, does not get from the middle of the bat, but it goes away for a couple
tucked it to the leg side and they are through for a single
on his pads and no turn, Permaul sweeps hard and gets it in the gap, Sunny continues to leak runs and this ones goes to the fence too
too short and wide and allows him to cut it to point for a single
another one that is drifted on to his pads, poor ball yet again and the batsman is able to sweep it, does well but to the fielder and they get only a single
this is fuller on the middle stump, better line than the previous ones and he still unleashes the sweep that gets him a single to deep fine-leg, 200 comes up
straighter, fuller and defensive stroke off the front foot
length ball and he tries to work it to the leg side, to the fielder close in
another wide, down the pads of the batsman, the one of many we have seen these three ODIs at Dhaka
played away to the leg side and they are away for a single
another one on the pads and he is able to tuck it away for another one, good turn there
middle stump line and turn back again, gets his front foot out, pushes it to the leg side for a single

appeal for run-out and third umpire called! yep, he is gone, it was tucked to the leg side and the non-striker wanted a single, he was halfway there before he was sent back by Thomas, the throw came in quite quickly from short fine-leg and was well taken by the bowler, who then throws the ball on to the stumps and the batsman is well out, eight down!
outside the off stump, short of length and tapped away to the off side
fullish ball on the off stump, he goes for a drive, hits it off the middle of the bat and almost beats the mid-off fielder, Sunny, and by the time he recovers they get a single
short of length outside the off, pushed to the off side but this time to the fielder
this is pulled back by the bowler, on the good length and he knocks it towards mid-off for a quickly taken run
on the off stump line and slower, he is able to open the face of the bat through to third-man

that is short and outside the off, Thomas goes for a pull, gets nowhere near the middle and it pops up to the deep square-leg region, by the time fielder runs in from back of square, they are back for the second
on he middle stump, not too much turn as it is full and it is tapped back to the bowler
goes down the track and wants to hit it over mid-on, gets slightly under it, gets an inside edge to deep square-leg
outside the off stump and wants to cut it away, gets it well but goes straight to the fielder
turn and he is almost squared up by Razzaq, plays with soft hands to the covers
short of length this time and he goes back, cuts it away to deep cover for a single
gives it bit of air and it is edged to the right of the bowler, rolls over to the mid-off fielder and by the time he gets there, they get a single
on the off stump and he wants to hit it over the bowler, gets it very hard on the ground and it goes back to the bowler
outside the off and he wants to hit it inside-off, slices it to wide long-off for a couple
slower and he cuts it to the cover fielder within the circle for a single

appeal for a caught-behind and given! it was shorter and down the leg side and he wanted to hook it away, gets something on it on the way through to the keeper, there is a huge appeal from the keeper and the bowler joins in later. The umpire thinks awhile before ruling it in favour of the bowler
on the back foot and defended back to the bowler
given out, lbw! that was drifting down the leg side from a length, he was on the back foot but I don't think it was going to hit the stumps, still, given out and West Indies are bowled out for 217

inn2.comm: really quick ball, on the pads and Tamim wants to flick it away, gets a bit of an inside edge and there is an appeal for an lbw, given not-out
short of length and he sways away from the line of the ball this time and lets it go through to the keeper
goes for a drive to one angling away from the left-hander, almost gets an edge through to the keeper, well bowled!
and beaten again! it comes back into the left-hander and fortunately for him, the ball goes over the stumps, yesterday he was bowled off a similar one!
too quick for Tamim there, it was outside the off and moving away and by the time the bat came down, it was through to the keeper
and hit up and over, was short and wide and he punches it over the point fielder and for four!
outside the off and slower in the air, played to the covers
stump to stump, not too much swing on that one and he defends it back
short of length, on the off and pushes it to the covers off the back foot
edged and given not-out? that seemed like there was a noise as it went past the bat, straight to the keeper and given not-out!
outside the off and moving away from the batsman and this one was left alone by the batsman
quicker from Sammy and on the off, good length too and he is forced to defend there, back to the bowler, maiden for the captain
shot, what a shot, that is one of the best we have seen today, short of length and on the middle stump and he is on his back foot, punching it through the covers! lazy elegance there...

gone, bowled, poor shot! and for the second time in two games, Tamim's bowled by Roach, fuller on the middle and that swung across to hit the off, but most vitally, he tried to play across the line, what a ball!
short of length on the off stump, plays it to third-man for a single, off the mark there
short of length and jagging back into the batsman, gets some bounce and pace on that one and hits the back pad
snorter there from Roach! short of length and on the off stump, was angling into the batsman and suddenly goes away from the batsman, almost an edge!

edged and stupendously taken at point! two wickets in an over and this has to be an excellent catch! it flew off to the fielder at point, where Pollard had to first rush in and then jump in front of him to take a superb catch, just inches off the ground
outside the off stump and moving away from the bat, lets it go through to the keeper
up and over, good shot from the batsman but in the air, it was fuller and outside the off, giving him some room and he hits it over extra-cover for a four!
short of length now after that previous one, jags back into the bat as well and hits him on the pads
on the middle, length ball and defended back to the bowler
fuller, not too quick but bit of swing there, taps it down to mid-off
almost half-volley length and right up to the bat, this time he defends back to the bowler, does not get tempted by the length of that delivery
short of length, outside the off stump and rising up from length and he almost fends it off to the covers
hits him from one that on the off stump and prodigiously swinging back into the bowler, that was a ripper! Was nowhere close to defending it and smack on the thigh
slashes it through the point region for four! it was short and wide and quite a risky stroke, just eludes the left of the point fielder
whoa, the ball is nipping around and at pace! what a snorter yet again, comes in after pitch and at high pace, hits the batsman yet again!

upper cut and for a four! each time Roach has pitched it shorter, Rahim has gone for it, and this time he is able to get it over the slips and to the left of third-man for another four, exciting stuff!
short of length and that has been cut away yet again, the point fielder gets bit of a hand to it and it goes to third-man for a single
outside the off and he wanted to leave it but gets bit of a bat on it when he was taking the bat away, gets an edge to third-man
shorter in length and swinging away from the batsman, misses the outside edge through to the keeper
fuller from the bowler, enough room to drive at it, but he pushes it down to mid-off and wants a single, is sent back by his captain
length ball on the off stump, defended back to the bowler
outside the off and pitched up the batsman, he wants to drive at it but gets the outside half of the bat, gets away to the covers
misses his line of this occasion, it goes down the leg side and he swings his bat at it, hit on his pads and rolls over to fine-leg
outside the off stump and short of length, he was getting his foot forward but almost ends up edging it to the keeper
hits hard and high on the bat there, short of length and he is on the back foot, defends it to the off side
another one, short of length and on the off stump, he is able to take his bat away this time, not looking confortable but at least doing his job
pitched up and driven through the covers, well played, almost like he expected it to be in his half, gets three and rotate the strike
yorker length there and well dug out by Rahim, puts his bat down in time and defends it to mid-on
pinned on the back-foot there off a ball on good length, and as was the case even in the last over, the ball was nipping back sharply into Rahim, hits his thigh pad, absorbing a lot of blows here
outside the off and swinging away from the batsman, he opens the face of the bat and guides it through to the right of third-man, gets a couple
almost an edge! that was outside off and moving further away yet again, he was trying to guide it away yet again and almost gets an edge
short of length and defended on the back foot, back to the bowler
jagging back into the bowler and hits his pads, they are off for a quick one
outside the off and fuller from Sammy, enticing that drive which Rahim does play this time but straight to the cover fielder
edged to the gully fielder but on the bounce, it was angling into the bat and then leaves him slightly from length

edged and flies to the keeper! that was quick and zipped through to the batsman, it was nipping back to the batsman too and hits his gloves, flies off them and goes to the keeper, end of a tortured stay
short of length from Roach and Mahmudullah has stroked it through the point region for a four, what a start!
short of length and going down the leg side, called wide by the umpire even as the keeper was jumping up and down in joy, thinking that it was out!
short again and he sways away very easily this time, well played there
another bouncer and this time it called a wide by the umpire, the batsman was almost walking away from the line of the delivery and it seemed to have gone above head
short of length yet again, and Mahmudullah punches it through the covers yet again, the ball does not race off too quickly and they get three.
whoa, that was jagging back quite sharply and the batsman leaves it alone, almost shaves the off stump off en route to the keeper
fuller, on the middle stump and this time he flicks it away to the mid-wicket fence for a fence, all this while the deliveries were on a length to Rahim, not this one
short of length and he wants to pull it, misses, goes under his bat!
short of length and that has been defended off the back foot, to the off side
fuller on the middle stump and very effortlessly flicked away to the square-leg region for a couple of runs
fullish on the off stump this time and he goes for a drive, hits it well but goes straight to the fielder
poor, poor ball down the leg-side, kept swinging and beats both, the batsmen and the keeper for five wides
another one down the leg-side and another wide, too many of them in these last two games
short and shot! it was just short of good length and he goes for a pull, whacks it hard and it goes away for a four!
lovely, lovely shot from the man in form! it was fuller outside the off stump and Mahmudullah times it, and more vitally places it rather well, through wide mid-off and for four
keeps it around the off stump and on a good length, lets it go through to the keeper
another one in the same area, similar line and length, nips away from the batsman, through to the keeper
poor ball from Russell, width given, short of length and not too much pace either, cut away through the in-field for a four
comes from wide off the stumps and the ball hits the length and goes away from Rahim, who lets it go through to the keeper
this is just bad bowling, another one that has been cut away to the fence for a four, beats the point, beats the third-man and the short and wide ball is punished
fuller on the off stump and he defends it back to the bowler
fuller on the off stump and he stretches forward in defence
outside the off and bit of turn back, not too much pace and cut away to deep point
short of length and defended on the back foot
sharp turn into the batsman, and tucked away to short fine-leg
fuller on the off stump, this is tapped away to the point fielder and wants a single, but the non-striker was having none of it
that is rather short and has been easily cut away to the backward point region for a four!
down the leg side, a quicker one from Russell, whipped away to fine-leg for a single, fumble by the fielder but restricted to a single
short of length and marginally outside the off, he gets behind it and defends well

up in the air and almost gone! that is lucky, it was shorter and really quick, Rahim was on the back foot fending, gets a bit of bat and it jumps up and lands between the bowler and the keeper, both rushing in
short of length and wider, tries to cut it, gets off the middle of the bat but to the point fielder

short again and he has pulled it over for a four! it was not too well hit, was a top-edge and carries to the fielder at fine-leg, the fielder there, Powell, was a few yards in front of the boundary and it goes over him but does not go for a six!
swinging away and absolutely full, has to dig it out by putting his bat down in time, defended
short of length, spin back into the batsman and cut away to the sweeper fielder
fuller on the off stump and Rahim defends it on the front foot
short of length and Rahim defends it off the back foot this time, close to the pitch
and this time he gets one shorter and outside the off, cut away to the deep point fielder
a lot of spin back into the batsman and hits his pads
slower, floated up in the air and he gets his bat and pad out and defends to the leg side, gets a single
that is another short one from Russell and for some reason the Bangladeshi batsmen are going after him, this time Mahmudullah gets it away to fine-leg for a single
bouncer but too far over the bowler's head, lets it go this time and for a wide
smell that leather! another bouncer and he sways away from the line and lets it go through to the keeper
fullish length this time from Russell, middle stump line too and flicked away to mid-wicket, straight to the fielder
and he pitches right up yet again, but the drift is taking it down the leg side, able to tuck it away to mid-wicket for a single
down the leg side, it was short of length and misses the line completely, the batsman wanted to pull it away but does not get any bat on it
another bouncer and he wants to go after it, goes over his horizontal bat there
outside the off stump, short of length and punched to the covers
short, spinning into the batsman and he punches it through the covers for a couple of runs
fuller, slower in the air and gets him on to the front foot, he defends at it
ouanother one on the off stump, that is reasonably fuller, tapped away to the leg side, not for runs though
quicker on the off stump, not an iota of turn and that has been cut hard to deep point for a single
shifts it to the middle stump, the line, and he taps it to the leg side for a single
the carom-ball comes out and it is quick and turning away from the bat, beats the outside edge of the bat through to the keeper
round the stumps, and on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
fuller and that same middle stump line, Rahim gets his foot forward and defends
pitches it right up to the bat but slightly away from the off stump, pushes it to the covers for a single
floats it up the stumps, the batsman gets an outside edge that runs away through the slips, a couple of runs is the result
that is a quicker one, on the off stump, and defended away to the off side
off stump line and that is patted away to the off side
outside the off and pushed to the off side for a single
down the leg side, drifts it away from the stumps and beats the forward defensive stroke but a wide called
shortens his length this time, on the middle stump, tapped to short fine-leg
fuller on the middle and defended away to the mid-wicket region
straight, no turn, on the middle and defended back to the bowler
quicker one, darted down the leg side and wide called again, not good bowling here from West Indies
quicker one, darted down the leg side and wide called again, not good bowling here from West Indies
whoa, well bowled but a no-ball! it was on the off stump, a carom ball, takes the outside edge and runs away through where the slip would have been for a four, Free Hit!
this is a quick one, almost swinging away from the bat and he drills it to the deep fielder for a single
full-toss outside the off and driven well, but to the short cover
yorker length ball that one, again almost a full-toss and tapped away
fuller on the off stump, he wanted to crash it through the covers but cannot get it into the gap
wow, what a shot! that has been pitched right up to the bat and drilled through the covers, it seemed like it was a cross-seam delivery and the batsman had no difficult in sending it to the fence
short and pulled away to the fence for another four! what a blow that is!
short of length yet again and this time he tucks it away to the deep square-leg for a single
slower from Permaul, turning away from the batsman and he defended to the off side
outside the off and that has been crashed through the covers for a single
shorter in length yet again and that has been cut away to the deep fielder on the off side for a single
slower, fuller on the middle and driven to short cover
bad ball outside the off, it was quicker with a lot of room and fuller too, it has been slashed away through backward point and off it goes for a four!
fuller from round the stump, gets his bat and pad out together and defended to the leg side
bit of bounce from length and turn as well and Rahim plays it well, keeps it down by taking the bottom hand off
turn and bounce again but down the leg side and for a wide
this is fuller and Rahim goes for a slog sweep, almost goes to the deep fielder at square-leg, falls short of the fielder, on the bounce
tries to defend it, gets an inside edge that flies off the bat and just evades the short-leg fielder
wow, they continue bowling wides! another one down the leg side and a single added to the score
fuller on the middle and Rahim drives this time instead of playing that sweep, single more
bowled him, off a top-spinner! was trying to cut it away from the off stump, went through quicker and it was a top-spinner too, an unhappy Mahmudullah departs
fuller and driven down the ground for a single
turn from round the stumps and pats it away to the leg side for a single
short of length and spinning away from the batsman, he cuts it hard and goes through to the deep point fielder
on a length and he gets room to cut, the ball bounces a tad more and is able to only play it to the fielder in the covers
shorter from the bowler and he goes back, pulls it away to the deep square-leg fielder for a single
on the off stump, turning away from the batsman, tapped to the off side
defends on the front foot and the inside edge gets him a single to the fine-leg region
short of length and he was going back to cut it, done well, gets it through the backward point
quicker and turning right back into the batsman, sharp turn too and tucked away to the leg side
fullish delivery on the off stump, punched through the covers for another couple of runs, good batting here
on the middle and slight turn back to the batsman, tucks it away to the leg side
shorter and he is on the back foot, defending it to the off side, not for runs though
appeal for catch in the slips but that came off the pads, quicker on the off stump and bit of turn back, lobs up to Gayle
bouncer again from Russell and he lets it go rather easily
just short of the good length and wider as well, the batsman was going for it, does not time it too well
short and makes him hop there, was in the line of his body and he takes his bottom hand off, manages to keep it down
another one that is on the good length, does not come forward, defends from within the crease
slower bouncer there and he wanted to pull it away, instead gets the toe end of the bat and it flies off to the covers
he is testing them with bouncers and this one is called a wide, Rahim let that one go by swaying away
good length ball and jagging back into the batsman, misses his bat by a mile, hits the pad instead and it rolls over to square-leg for a single

gone, bowled, that is quite a freak one! it ripped into the batsman who was defending on the back foot, he played it with a straight bat, the ball bounced in front of him after the shot and then rolled back to hit the stumps, Rahim tried to kick it away but came nowhere close, end of a superb knock
well bowled to the new man, on the middle and moving away and defended rather well
spinning away very quickly from Narine and beats the outside edge of the bat
uppishly hit and it has been dropped by the captain, what a letoff! it was fuller on the off and he went for the stroke, gets it to the right of Sammy at short cover and he floors it
outside the off, turning away and cuts it to the deep cover
fuller on his pads and flicked to mid-wicket, wanted to go for the single but sent back
down the leg side, poor line without any swing and given wide
on the good length and moving away from the off stump, tapped to the off side
fuller and outside the off stump and went for a drive and he misses it, why would you play that stroke given the asking rate?
middle stump line and angling away, defended back to the bowler
short of length and he goes for a pull, he was nowhere in the position to pull it and gets the top-edge, the fine-leg rushes in but just falls short of that one
on the middle stump and a length ball, he goes back and defends to the off side, bit of a nervous prod
just outside the off, short of length and pushed to the off side
on a length outside the leg and bit of turn away from the bat, defended on the back foot, pushed to the off
spins from the leg to middle and he is on the back foot, pats it back to the bowler
and repeats that same stroke, short of length and pushes it to the bowler
defended with bat and pad together, this was fuller from the bowler
and he rips it past the bowler this time and just misses the outside edge through to the keeper
defended on the back foot, to the off side
short of length, on the middle and turning back to the batsman, tucked away for a single
outside the off and that has been cut well to the deep fielder, should have been a single but a tardy piece of fielding from Russell allows it go through for a four, it has been a poor day for him.
fuller, slower from round the stumps and defends it back to the bowler
same line and length and the stroke is not too different, defend back to the bowler
shorter again and this is cut away to the deep point fielder where it is fielded this time
very short from Samuels and he pivots around his back foot and pulls it for a single
quick, outside the off stump and he defends it off the front foot to point
short of length yet again and he is quickly on to the back foot, defends to the off
down the leg side from Roach, swinging down and for a wide
testing his ability to play off the back foot, pegs him back and he fends it to the off side for a quickly taken single
shorter in length and angling away from his bat, goes for a cut but misses the outside edge through to the keeper
another one that is outside the off and goes rapidly across the batsman, misses the outside edge
and another one across him, attempts that roll of the wrist cut shot but goes past the edge of the bat
fuller on the off stump and he drives it to mid-off
outside the off, length ball and wanted to cut it away, gets nowhere near the ball and misses
and now a tad shorter and pegs the batsman back, fended it off to the off side
short of length outside the off stump and that has been cut, finally gets some bat on it, single to the deep point fielder
this is cut away well, it was wide outside the off stump and is easily able to play it through point for a couple of runs
short of length and it is fended off his face, well played in the end
a very short one from Permaul and gets easily over it, cuts it to deep point for a single
short of length from over the stumps, defended on the back foot to mid-on
shorter in length again, turning into the batsman and defended back
fuller from the bowler and he takes front front foot out and defends
fuller from Permaul, pitched right up to the batsman on the off stump and driven to the right of the bowler
very short from the bowler and he had ample time to rock back and cut but misses it and shouts out in anguish
fullish on the middle, he tries to punch it down the ground, gets it only to mid-off
shorter in length and he goes for the pull, again, not very convincing there and gets a top edge that goes over the in-field and to fine-leg, only a single
edged and goes for a four! it was a thick one and it goes through where third slip would have been, fine enough to beat the third-man fielder
short again and he pulls it to fine-leg for a single, not great bowling from Russell this
and a short one yet again, makes it easy for the batsman to guide it to third-man this time for a single
this is a bouncer and a good one, on the line that he would want it and fended off by the left-hander
down the leg side, slower from round the stumps, flicks the pads and goes away for a single

fuller, and that is beaten everyone! it is one of the few that Permaul has managed to turn, comes into the batsman, was defending at it and beats him, goes over the stumps, beats the keeper and goes for byes!
fuller and driven down the ground, back to the bowler
fuller yet again and that is driven to long-off for a single
flights it up to the bat, inviting that drive and that is exactly what he does, remains in the air for some time and goes to mid-on on the bounce
fuller, coming into the batsman and driven down the ground for a single
he continues to pitch them short of length and while the batsmen may not always look comfortable, not getting the wickets
short of length again and pulled away to the fine-leg fielder for a single
fullish for a change and he drills it past cover for a single this time
short of length and he goes for a pull, does not get it too far, straight to mid-on
another bouncer, continuing to bowl those and he lets it go through to the keeper
short of length again, that is the umpteenth one he has bowled tonight and easily pulled away to deep square-leg for a single
goes down the track and drills it back to the bowler
slower from the bowler and slightly short too, he is able to tuck it away but to the fielder
fuller on the off stump, tries to sweep it away, can get it away only to short fine-leg
defended on the front foot, back to the bowler
goes down the track and wants to whack it over the fielder at long-on, gets no timing there and it pops on a few bounces to the fielder
round the stumps and on off stump, he pushes it to the covers but not for a run
down the leg side here and another wide, Russell continues to bowl rather waywardly
fuller and driven to the off side, goes to the deep cover
fullish ball, on the off stump, just the kind of length Russell probably needs to bowl, defended to the off side
outside the off stump and on a length, wants to drive it through the covers but does not time it too well
fullish ball this time and tapped away to the deep third-man region for a single
fuller outside the off and he is able to pierce the in-field, goes through to the deep cover fielder for a single
and he is back to bowling that short ball that he loves sending down, only this time he is ready for it and pulls it away to backward square-leg for a four
shorter in length and defended on the back foot, back to the bowler
quicker, outside the off and went for a cut, misses and straight to the keeper
turns back into the batsman, defends on the front foot, bit of an appeal
carom ball going away and cuts it to the deep backward point region and they are off for a single
another one beaten outside the off, wants to cut hard but there was too much turn on it, beats him
leaves the last ball of the over through to the keeper, not making him and ends a good over
shorter in length, spins away from the batsman and cuts it but to the short point fielder
round the stumps and drifts on to his pads, wants to tuck it away, hits the pads
fullish on the pads and what a shot, he has smacked it over mid-wicket for a six!
outside off and spinning away, but the shortness of the delivery allows it to be cut through point for a couple
outside the off, goes for a cut and misses, there is a loud appeal for a caught-behind but no-one but the wicket-keeper appealed there!
fuller on the leg stump, driven back to the bowler
gone, round the stumps and lbw! was quicker and straighter and the batsman misses it, hits his front pad and given!
fuller on the off and defended to the off side
shorter from Narine, goes back and cuts it away to the deep point region, the fielder has to run back from within the circle and after bit of a fumble, he fields and hurls it back
on the off stump, flighted and defended back to the bowler
opens the face of the bat and through the slip region for a couple, it was a straighter one, a top-spinner
fuller and driven back to the bowler, ends Narine's spell
slogs it away, over mid-on for a four, that is some confidence! it was round the stumps and he hit it across the line, well done Gazi
fuller and he is playing off the back foot, defended and almost rolls back on to the stumps
up and over and he seems to be in a hurry here! fuller on the pads and he has been dispatched over the mid-wicket for another four!
caught and bowled dropped! he went down the track again and smacked it, back to the bowler, and he spills it to his left!
fuller on the middle stump and he hits it inside out and in the air to long-off, just falls short of the long-off fielder!
tempting the batsmen into taking some risks here but he does it well to tuck it away for a single
driven down the ground for another four...punched down to mid-on, the fielder had to dive to his left and did not get close
on the pads and flicked away to fine-leg for a single
short of length and angling in, on the back foot and tapped away to the leg side
digs it in slightly shorter and he is on the back foot and defends it back to the bowler
he was expecting a bouncer there and ducked into a length ball and he was lucky he had his bat in front of the face, gets the edge through to third-man
keeps digging them short but for now, there is no pace and easily defended on the back foot
short of length and goes to cut it, the fielder at covers is inside the circle
fuller in length and he goes down the track, drives it down the ground for a single
short and wants to pull it away, does not get hold of it and it falls in front of the deep square-leg fielder, for a single
on the middle and defended off the front foot, back to the bowler
goes down the track and wants to crash it through, manages to get his bat down
round the stumps, slowly comes into the bat and defends, the leading edge flies off to the off side for a single
whoa, that has been upper cut to the fence! this was short from Roach and he was waiting, went after it, goes over the two slips in place and goes one bounce into the fence
fuller and driven to mid-on, not for a run
outside the off stump and he goes for a cut, misses the outside edge of the bat
edged and taken! gone, caught by the wicket-keeper, it was another shorter one but close to the body, turned out to be snorter, seven down now.
whoa, he was trying for a yorker it seems and it slips out of his hands, full-toss over waist and the bowler immediately apologises!

big, big appeal given out but was it pitching outside? that is a big one, pitching way outside the off and that is a very poor decision given at a very crucial time, Razzaq's gone and Bangladesh is still three short
short of length and defended off the back foot
short of length and on the pads, he tucks it away to the leg side for a single
outside the off stump and lets it go through to the keeper
bouncer and left well, swayed away with the eyes on the ball, the gloves were close to the ball but does not hit them
another short of length and tapped away to the leg side, they are off for a very quick single to tie the game

that was cut away but the ball does not get to fence, the batsmen don't cross over thinking it has gone to the fence and by the time the ball is retrieved back, the stumps have been uprooted by the batsmen. West Indies are appealing for a run-out or probably telling the umpires that the run was not completed! wow drama!
phew, now that is a boundary, cut away to the fence for a four this time, and this time it is definitely a win!
